Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When the humidity of the veins affects the channel of the lung, and especially when this is accompanied by coldness in complexion, one should first evacuate the patient at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that part above the root of the throat.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful not to reach the cauterization to the throat, nor burn more than a little of the skin.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that area with another cautery at the junction of the collarbone and the last cervical vertebra.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And let the cautery be made in the shape of a nail following the previous method.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that area with what has been prescribed until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIV.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On cautery for lung disease and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are due to cold humidity without fever or consumption and the illness is chronic, then cauterize that area with two cauteries above the clavicles in the upper armpit areas; and with another cautery at the middle location of the chest between the two nipples; and let the cauteries be made in the shape of a nail according to the previous method.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, your cautery can be done punctually with a cautery called puncta, the form of which is described in the section on piercing ear pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	Let them puncture into veins those things which are intended for that purpose; and afterwards treat that part with the methods mentioned before so that it may be healed.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And let there be three cauteries for that cautery, because with one application you can perform three cauteries in this manner:
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On cautery for the treatment of the tremor that affects the head.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the helper is dislocated due to humid and slippery causes and it does not return to its normal position after the dislocation, you should first reduce the dislocation and then lay the patient on their back or side; subsequently, raise the neck which is in the part inside the skull upwards with your left hand if the joint is dislocated inwardly.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then apply the cautery having two tips; and this is the form of it:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then cauterize the neck so that it penetrates into the opposite side; and the figure of the cautery will now have four tips after this procedure.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And adjust that finely according to the amount needed; and this is the form of it:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And at times it is adjusted according to this method, and thus the cauteries will be eight.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And then place the cautery over it covered with salt, and subsequently keep the patient calm, and do not move the limb for some time until it is healed.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is at the upper parts, do it thus: immediately cauterize over the muscle with a cautery nail or with pointed cauteries, for the joint is confirmed and the moisture is consumed and the ailment is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	On Cauterization of the Stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When there is bleeding in the stomach, fry and mix dry substances within it that match its composition and multiply them as much as possible. And if you continue with the methods of treatment without confirmation, then it must be that the ailment is on its second day subsiding, and extend its uses and its things, and immediately cauterize that area with three cauteries: one cauterization below the feet by the length of a finger, and two pointed cauteries below each side of the middle cauterization, so that the figure of the cauterizations forms a triangle; and stretch them apart so they do not touch, which will prevent putrefaction.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cauterization is the quantity of two-thirds of the thickness of the rib.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And let the figure of the cauterization be in this form without addition. And if you want, cauterize with a large cautery at the middle part of the stomach in this form; and this shall be a cautery in the shape of a circle in this form:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And let the stomach be cauterized with points for one who is frightened by this cautery: and that you mark on the stomach with points in the quantity you wish with a needle, and then cauterize those points with a cautery; and then treat it with the treatment that precedes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVII.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	On cauterization of an inflamed bladder.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When pain arises in the bladder due to coldness or humidity or excessive flatulence that causes the normal urine to be expelled through excessive urination, and when this ailment is treated with the water method as we have described and does not provide relief, then the patient should lie on their back with their head raised. In this position, three cauteries are applied below the bladder near the hypochondria, in the manner and quantity specified.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And the space between each caustic should be according to the thickness of a finger, and the size of the cauteries should be according to the length of the right arm.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not compress the area around the cauteries.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the amount of water retained is half the capacity of a jug and not more; and if the patient stands on their feet; and if they cannot stand, then they should sit, having prepared their belongings, and raise their arms.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible for you to perform these cauteries with a knife cauterization when you possess subtlety and prudence in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And be careful not to press too hard during the cauterization, and let it retain the capacity of a whole jug so that the entire body retains moisture and reaches the bladder, for here the urethra is delicate; and know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On the Incision of an Abscess of the Testicle with Caustics.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When you find an inflammation or abscess in the testicle and want to know if that abscess is in the flesh of the testicle or in the tunica, then if it is in the flesh of the testicle, the patient will complain of heaviness and pain without sharpness.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the tunica of the testicle, then the pain will be sharp and often it exhausts the skills of the physicians to treat it.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore, the patient should be positioned on his back; then feel the location of the abscess carefully; and subsequently apply the cautery which resembles a reed, the form of which was described on the previous page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize with that cautery until the entire area is consumed, until it reaches the cicatrix, until it becomes dry and heals.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that abscess like the treatment of other abscesses until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And it is not appropriate to use this form of cautery except by one whose study in the art of medicine is extensive and who has known many diseases; but even then, this experiment should be attempted only a few times on such an operation, but rather leave that to us, and it is better.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On the Cauterization of Hemorrhoids.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancients said that cauteries made from the roots of aristology should be applied to hemorrhoids according to this method: take one root of aristology, which is dry and long, as long as your finger, and has a thickness like that of your finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	Here is the translation into English:
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And do not be afraid to use your cautery, but apply it openly in front of the wound.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And just as some ancient authors say that some men used to cauterize with a hot iron like a ray of fire and heated it, and placed it in the place between the shoulders until it reached the abscess so that the pus could be evacuated from it, as we have said regarding the testicular abscess.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	But in this perforation with the cautery there is no need for fear, for one dies immediately or an accident occurs at the place where the fistula is located and where there is no cure.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On the Cauterization of Boils.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you treat the disease of boils as we have discussed in the division and do not confer your treatment, at that time the cautery is done in three ways, all of which are effective. One way is to make three or four cauterizations along the length of the boil according to its figure, similar to the shape of the testicular cauteries, the description of which has been given previously.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And there should be a space of the width of one finger or a bit more between each cauterization, and the method of the cautery should be the same method we have described for the testicular cauteries as well.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not be afraid to use your cautery; and the patient should lie on their back for this treatment.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And there is another method of cauterizing, which is to heat the cautery vertically in two places, as we have described in the chapter on dislocation of the muscle, and elevate the side where the boil is located, so that the patient's left side faces upwards.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And so raise it up as you raise the chain according to the length of the body, so that cauteries may be made according to the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then insert the two ends, one ignited, into that opening where each of them penetrates the chain from the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then remove the cautery; and thus four cauteries are made.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you wish, cauterize with a cautery having three ends.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then take care of the cautery so that it does not shake for too many days, for it is more convenient than other causes previously mentioned in the treatment.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXXI.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	On Cauterization of Hydrops.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Cautery is not used in hydrops except in some specific cases.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When you treat the hydrops using the methods of treatment we have mentioned in the division and do not conform to your treatment, then it is necessary that you cauterize with four cauteries around the navel, and one cauterization over the stomach, and another cauterization over the liver, and another cauterization over the spleen, and two cauteries between the vertebrae of the back, and one cauterization on the right foot, and another cauterization over the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the quantity of the depth of the cautery should be proportionate to the thickness of the chain.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And then leave the cautery open so that it shakes for a long time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	If you do not remove the harmful matter from the treatment before applying heat with water that is suitable for joining the two edges, it will be necessary to hurry with assistance for healing.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery with which the abdomen is cauterized should be in the form of a nail as described above, and the one with which the back is cauterized should be in the shape of an olive according to its preceding description.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter XXXII.
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	On Cauterization of the Feet and Other Matters.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are affected by abscesses and are filled with serous fluid, it is suitable to cauterize them above the second toe using water that is between lukewarm and warm, and raise your hand with the cautery without twisting it; then lift your hand and do not return it completely, as the serous fluid will drain.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	The cautery should be in this form: And then apply two cauteries on each of the two areas, and at each area use a cautery with the tip of the cautery.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And the cautery should be in accordance with the length of the area: one below the joint and the other at the middle part of the area; and apply two cauteries on each area.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And leave the wound uncovered during treatment for some time so that some fluid can drain from it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And then treat with the causes that we have mentioned.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On cauterization of abdominal wounds.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When abdominal wounds are due to friction and internal humidity that weakens the vital forces, which are the digestive and retentive faculties located in the stomach and intestines, it is treated with hot applications according to the methods of treatment and should not be neglected. Sometimes when the patient endures well, apply a strong cautery over their stomach as previously described for stomach cauterization, using a circular cautery and four subtle cauteries around the navel, or a subtle nail-shaped cautery; sometimes two such cauteries are applied on both sides of the navel.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if there are excessive humidities and the patient can tolerate it, then apply the cautery over the navel and around the intestines, gently placing two cauteries on the stomach and near the inguinal regions, for this is a perfect method of treatment from which you will not deviate.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter XXXIV.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	On cauterization of chronic hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When there is a natural tendency towards chronic hemorrhoids or one caused by thick humors or corrupted humidities, they are treated as we have described in the division and should not be neglected. Then apply three cauteries below the spine on both sides near the small triangular area, and place another cautery above the navel, positioned between these two.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if you find that the stomach is irritated and the food is not being digested, and the face appears swollen or inflamed, then apply a strong cautery over the stomach as previously described; place one cautery on the spleen and another on the liver with a nail-shaped cautery. Allow this treatment to continue for some time until the patient is healed inside.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	On the cautery of the artery near the removal of the tooth.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you extract a tooth, apply the cautery that resembles a ray.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Near the extracted tooth, introduce the heated cautery, but do not insert it so far that the cautery reaches the opening of the vein from which the blood comes.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do this once or twice, for if the tooth becomes too sore, then cauterize each of them as we have described, and subsequently treat them with what you consider appropriate from among the remedies until they are healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery over the gum, it is better to do so gently.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter XXXVI.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On the cautery of fistulas that are formed in the nature near the parts down there.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not respond to the treatment we have recommended in its place, and the patient is afraid of that, heal it with a cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	When someone has a fistula in the nature behind, and it is old, with corrupt pus and moisture, then what should be done first is to probe it carefully, and subsequently you will know the depth of it by means of the previously mentioned probe.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Then heat the cautery that resembles a rod.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	Then place the heated cautery into this fistula according to how deep the probe went.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And then apply the cautery to burn those corrupted tissues once or twice or three times, according to the extent of your need.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And guard against burning nerves and veins; or if the fistula leads to the body of the bladder or to the body of the intestine, then guard against all those places; and do this only when the fistula is in a fleshy location and you think it will not penetrate.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the place so that it may heal.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the place is sealed and the substances are absorbed, and it remains this way for a long time, then you will know that it is completely healed.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the substances do not remain inside but come out, then you will know that it is penetrating or in the area of the bone that is corrupted, or this happens due to those causes which will be recalled in its place.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter XXXVII.
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	On Cauterization of Warts.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When warts cause pain due to rubbing or excessive swelling, and because of this the patient suffers discomfort, then it is appropriate to cauterize them with a cautery on each wart using a nail of which the description will be recalled.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And apply the cauterization to each one after a small interval, so that there will be three cauterizations lined up, and thus they will be more effective in providing relief.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	On Cauterization of the Bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When it happens that in the bladder there is debility and softening due to rubbing and moisture such that the patient does not retain urine, at this time cauterize in the area near the pus just above the bladder, where the hair of the pubis begins, and cauterize with one cautery on the right side, and another on the left.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the amount of the pus; and cauterize with one cautery in the lower part near the two areas, or with two cauteries if necessary.
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And let it be a nail-shaped cautery according to the process.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	On Cauterization of the Wound.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When there is rubbing and moisture in the wound, and because of this it is prohibited to apply pressure, and her menstruation becomes corrupted, and the provocation of them is delayed, and pain occurs due to their occurrence, then it should be that the area be cauterized with three cauteries around the navel, as we have said regarding the cauterization of the bladder; and one cautery above the area near both sides, or two cauteries, and let the cautery be nail-shaped.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On Cauterization of the Dislocation of the Joint.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moisture and swelling are effused to the area of the joint, and the causes lead to the displacement from its location, and the sign of it is that the limb is prolonged over the other when they are compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	The place for reduction is found where the bone lies.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then you should cauterize the malady above the part of the bone in a circular manner, since you will have marked it with thread around the part just as it is turned, and so that the part falls on the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And this is the cautery which precedes the form in the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not available to you, now cauterize that part with three cauterizations using a large olive-shaped cautery.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And make the cautery according to the quantity of the spitting from the entire body; and then treat that intestine so that it may be healed.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XLI.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On Cauterization of the Sciatic Vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs in the part of the bone, and its cause is friction and humidity, the malady is treated as we have said and does not conform, and this is old-fashioned, now you should relieve the malady of thick humors with fetid pills or artificial pills or similar; and then cauterize that area.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the method of the cautery in this case is according to two methods: either use a cautery with combustible medicines, or use fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	It is done according to two known methods, one of which is that you should cauterize that area above the part of the bone with three triangular cauterizations following this form; and do it with proper depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And let the spaces which are between each cautery be the quantity of the thickness of a finger, and if the cauteries are olive or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	And in some cases let the cauteries be on the back part of the head, for there are four cauteries.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena. E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the method of cautery in cases where pain is adherent to the shoulder and does not extend into the arm.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if it extends into the arm, then cauterize that with two cauteries on the arm at the place to which you would direct the malady that is the pain; and one cauterization over the joint four fingers slightly towards the wilderness side.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery is cutellar, let the depth of the cautery be according to the quantity of the protrusion of the collarbone.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if you direct the malady that the pain extends into the area near the tips of the toes, then cauterize there where you would direct with one cautery at three points or four or more as you may need.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if you direct the malady that the pain is below the elbow on the arm, then cauterize there with one cutellar cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And be careful in all cauterizations that you do not end the cautery until you burn a nerve or large artery, and by this it is upon the malady without harm or contraction.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And I have seen one and another of those who cauterize over the nail and finish in the cauterization, and the bed of fire inflated until the tumor reached the flesh, and fire perforated and corrupted all the flesh.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And as a result of a severe purging of the bowels, and as a result of that death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts at once, cauterize each one according to this method.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the wise ones say in the cauterization of any cauterizing iron, which is made in this way: make it resemble a circle of iron whose circumference is half a palm; and let its hole be according to the thickness of a date stone or less by a little.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And inside that circle there should be another one a third of its size; and the space between them should be the quantity of a pea; and those circles should be divided into two parts; and the length of those bars should be the size of a pea or two peas, and attach these edges of iron decently to the circles; and this is the form of it.
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then ignite it in the fire until it turns red and sparks, and then place it on the affected part of the body, with the malady positioned on the back.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And thus cauterize that area three times in one session.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then let it rest for three days; then apply a plaster to that area and let the wound be covered for more than ten days; and then treat that area with remedies until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	O son, we have rarely used this type of cautery due to the fear of its observation, and because few people who observe it have found it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	Of the many cauteries applied to him who endures them, he finds great benefit from that one in particular.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	The most effective cauteries along with medicines are those you make in the shape of two circles using a perforated armula, through which fits the handle of an iron door; let the length of the walls be as thick as two nuts or somewhat larger.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the spaces between each are as wide as the thickness of a finger; and let them be raised both below and above, so that they fit together in this form:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And place it over the part of the arm where the patient is seated, and press your hand on that part of the arm; then take hot water and pour it between two circles, and let the quantity of this be small at first and gradually increase, and let it remain for about an hour, so that the patient endures the biting sensation and the application until the biting sensation ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	And then raise your hand to the instrument and wipe the hot water from the entire arm with cool water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And then leave it for three days and place a bandage on it until the discoloration from the application fades, and leave it like this for several more days until pus formation ceases; this is beneficial for recovery.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then care for it with remedies until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain extends into the chest or abdomen, place the patient in the position where they contain water, as is done with the hand.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the method of boiled water, and I have already written about it in the chapter on the preparation of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Recipe for alkali and soda not yet extinguished, both in equal parts; mix them and pour into a new vessel which has a small hole at the bottom through which it can run according to the quantity needed for the remedy.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And place under the bottom of the vessel another inverted vessel, and pour over that alkali and live soda with lukewarm water in which they absorb one finger's width, and then when you understand them to be warm by good compression, leave the hole through which the sharp water descends into the lower part of the inverted vessel.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	And then concentrate all that water, and pour it over fresh soda and alkali, because at this time it will have great strength, which is used in various medical procedures and in cauterizing other limbs, as a fire operation.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And for some medicines that are used for wide cauterization, such as vinegar and honey mixed with aniseed and soda, they should be blended.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	And here is the account of a man from ancient times regarding the operation and cure for treating pain in the sciatic vein and nerve; he praises it highly as being sufficient without needing any other treatment, since it heals completely once performed, as recommended, and taking baths and exercise thereafter.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And let it be applied near the seat of pain, and if there is no green onion, take a fresh fig; and let it be crushed with a little grease and placed on the water in which the pain is, or on the head, or on the thigh, and let it be bound.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And let it be applied for the quantity of three hours or for the amount that the patient finds comfortable from the treatment.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	And then put him in the bath, and when his body is relaxed, move him to the sun, for the pain will cease and he will be healed.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And know that it is not necessary for anyone to use cauterization with these medicines except after the evacuation of the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	But Galen says that when the narrow vein is cauterized with the split leg of a kid, it benefits the youth very much; and let the cautery be applied in this way: take wool and soak it in old oil, and place it between the toes and on the bones.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	And then take a dried split leg of a goat and burn it in the fire until it turns to charcoal; and then place it on the wool and let it be spread over it.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And then repeat this, and do not stop until the sensation of the bite reaches the water and the pain subsides.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this method of cautery is called cow cautery.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter XLII.
De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	On Cauterization for Pain in the Thighs.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida. E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	And cautery should not be used except in this single case, which is done by the application of dry matter.

Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XLIII.

Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV.
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	On the Cauterization of Gout and Joint Pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament. Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLV.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	On Cautery for Fractures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre. entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	make sure it is hot and sparks.

E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And it is appropriate that the cautery for children be delicate according to their size and measure.

E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And it should be that you pause the nutrition of him according to the length of time for the cure of which the intestines are within the belly, and that the bowel does not protrude due to the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And when you wish to remove it after forty days, administer a properly made bandage, and keep him for other forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And let him be restricted from work and overeating and drinking, and speaking loudly, for when he follows this regimen of complete healing, he will be healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I will speak of the cure of ruptures in other parts of the belly, and so at the beginning, if you do not want them to remain, then cauterize the rupture with a round cautery according to its size, and let that which is excised from it be as thick as one third of it; and thereafter treat it as we have said, and it will not require adjustment.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And some earlier ones said that the rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, as it is marked by a template:
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	and a line is marked where you will proceed latitudinally in the skin above the rupture, and another line above it; then mark your hand with a nail-shaped cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter XLVI.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	On cauterization of torsion.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain occurs in any member due to falling or striking and that pain persists for a long time and is not relieved by medicine or cure, then it is necessary to cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And let the cautery be applied to every member according to its size and smallness, its strength and weakness, the location of the torsion, and the site of the pain.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	If he is healed by the first cautery, that is good; but if not, then apply the cautery again. For it is customary with such pains that they are points of the member nearest to them, so you must achieve these points with the cautery until the patient is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter XLVII.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Some cases of leprosy are greatly helped by cautery, but rarely when the type of leprosy is caused by the putrefaction of flesh and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And so when you wish to cauterize that patient, consider whether the leprosy is commissional and has been partially cured by what we have said in the division and does not continue, and if you fear for the patient that the corruption may encompass the whole body and its entirety, then cauterize it over the head with four cauteries: one at the middle of the head, and the second further down near the forehead; both on two temples; and one at the back, above the neck or nape.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally with the cauteries, apply them slightly enough to create a small impression on the bone, so that the scales are displaced and allow the expulsion of thick vapors; and cauterize over the wound as needed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has already spread over the body and is clearly visible, then it is necessary that you cauterize those areas with the cauteries which we have mentioned at the beginning; one cauterization on the tip of the nose, two on each cheek, two on each side of the neck vertebrae, six on the lower back vertebrae, one large cauterization near the buttocks, one on each buttock, two on each thigh, one on each calf, two on each ankle and one on each heel, and two on each foot arch. Cauterize those areas over all the joints of the mentioned limbs and feet, and on each sole of their feet, and on the hollows of their hands.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And be careful of the nerves that run over the heel so that you do not burn them.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And in some cases, it is cauterized with one cautery on the bone of the little finger and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the spleen.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that the more you apply cauteries, the more beneficial and effective they are; and know that the patient does not feel pain from the cautery as others do, because his body is already numbed.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And it is necessary that the cauteries be large or few according to the limbs and joints, depending on the type of tools used.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And apply the cautery with flour of fried chickpeas mixed with honey, and continue the treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter XLVIII.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On cauterization for fainting.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a limb is numb or asleep and is treated with medicines, oils, and plasters, and does not heal, then you should cauterize that numb limb with cauteries according to the magnitude of the limb or the smallness of it.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let the fire for the cautery enter slightly under the surface of the skin.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with a remedy so that it may be healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And sometimes faintness is cauterized by treating certain points, which are mostly in the back and spine, and at the sites of the nerves that govern that limb, and thus the numbness is alleviated.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But do not proceed with this unless you are knowledgeable about the anatomy of the limb and the distribution of the nerves throughout the moving body.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter XLIX.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On cauterization of ulcers that are inflamed.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When an ulcer is old and does not respond to any of the medicinal remedies, then you should cauterize it with a cautery slightly above the surface according to the quantity of the depth under the skin until the whiteness and the color of it change.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with flour of eggs and lentils in rose oil and leaves of arnica, and the blood of dove or the blood of quail, taking an equal part of each and mixing them all together, and then apply a cloth soaked in this mixture until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter I.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	On cauterizing wounds.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer begins and you want to remove it, then cauterize that part with a cauterizing agent in the form of a circle around it as it appears.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the wise ones say that it should be cauterized with the final cautery in its proper place; but I have not seen this done, for I fear that it may become ulcerated, and I have observed this in some cases.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	It is more correct to cauterize around the part in a circular manner as we have said, or rather as described.
Capitol .li.	Chapter II.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	On cauterizing abscesses.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When an abscess is delayed in maturing, and this is due to the excessiveness of its formation or the condition of the patient, who is old and debilitated with little blood, or because of time, and you wish to hasten the maturation of the abscess; then cauterize around it with small punctures using a cautery instrument; and immediately apply something that will help it mature more quickly.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	But if you wish to puncture it with a cautery, then choose the cautery that has this shape; and place it in the proper location of the abscess until it penetrates the core.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery is applied to a location that is further away to spare the tissue of the arm; and then care for it until it heals.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter LII.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On cauterizing with corrosives.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	A corrosive is a wandering corruption in the limb, which eats away just as fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, when you see the corrosive in a place where it can withstand cautery with fire, then you ignite and cauterize small spots, and larger ones as is appropriate in the location where the corrosion is.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And proceed to cauterize it thoroughly until you eradicate all the corrosion and leave no cause for it to remain.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And then dress it for three days, and apply ointment mixed with oil to the cauterized spots three times a day until all the scars are eradicated and all the corruption is gone.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And then treat it with substances that promote flesh growth.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days you see that healthy flesh is growing where there is no corruption, it is good; but if not, then repeat the cautery on what remains in the corrupted areas.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And some corrosions are treated with sharp medicine, for that is the method instead of cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But cautery with fire is quicker to provide relief.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already described the treatment with sharp medicine in the division above, so use that when you deem it necessary.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter LIII.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On cauterizing of nails and other similar cases.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	In many cases, when dealing with the parts of the foot affected by severe illness called gout, which is caused by thick and swollen matter, you should cauterize it; there are two ways to do this, one is cauterization with fire and the other is cauterization with hot water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	Cauterization with fire is done by igniting the cauterizing instrument shaped like a half moon, which should be made of iron according to the quantity that will contain the thick matter from all parts, and it should have fine edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then place the ignited instrument over the thick matter, and then move your hand with the cauterizing instrument around the thick matter until the cauterization reaches the depth of the thick matter.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And let that remain for three days until it begins to discharge pus.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then apply a plaster made of crushed wild mugwort and salt to it, and leave the plaster on for one night, for this will help eradicate it from its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with a healing ointment for generating flesh until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not convert, and in many cases it occurs on the surface of the body, especially in the hands and feet, you should administer cauterization with hot water. Take a small tube made of iron or other material shaped like a half moon, and place it over the thick matter; then pour a little hot water into the tube and hold it with your hand while rotating it completely, pressing the edge of the tube against the root of the thick matter so that the hot water flows along the root of the thick matter. Wait for a short time after the application of the hot water for about an hour, and then remove it, as this will help eradicate the thick matter with its roots.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus you should approach each one that you may come upon all of which naturally in the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And approach the care of those pus that the roots of the nails are eradicated with those remedies which the flesh generates.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter LIII.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On the cautery for trembling.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When you encounter any trembling due to irritation in the nerves or from fever causing irritation, or from some similar cause, it is then appropriate that you cauterize it with four cauteries or five on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra with one cauterization; and at the feet of the patient, and above the stomach, use an olive-shaped cauterization.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the trembling of the patient subsides and the health hastens to overcome the illness.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter LIV.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On the cautery for accidental injuries to the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body there appear accidental swellings and sores that are caused by thick, corrupted matter; therefore, at the beginning when they appear, it is appropriate to be cauterized over the entire head of the fistula with a fine cautery made from myrtle wood, the tip of which is extended over fire; or with the long thorns of the erestologia plant; or with a lens-shaped cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And sometimes the cautery is also applied at the beginning of its expulsion according to this method; and if it does not occur as expected, the excess is disrupted by doing so, and heals from it.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	However, it must be done near evacuation or phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter LVI.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On cauterization of blood flow caused by an accidental cut to an artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	If the flow of blood from an artery that has been cut is due to the disease that caused it before, or due to the beginning of abscesses or cauterization of the limb, and similar cases, then it is difficult to remedy that.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	When such a thing happens, quickly take your finger and place it over the opening of the artery, and press on it so tightly that the blood flow stops below your finger, and does not escape.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And then place in the fire some small and large cauteries made of olive wood, many of them, and blow on them until they are lit.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take one of those cauteries, either small or large depending on the location and disease in which the artery is ruptured, and place it quickly after you have removed your finger, so that the blood is sealed and restricted.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the opening of the artery when you remove your finger and extract the cautery, then take another cautery quickly from those that are prepared in the fire, and continue doing this one after another until the blood is stopped.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful not to burn the nerve that is here, and make sure it does not cause other harm.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	Know that when blood flows from an artery, it is not possible to restrain the blood at that time, especially if the artery is large, unless you use one of four methods: either use cauterization as mentioned before, or perform ligation when it cannot be extracted, for when it is extracted the extremities beyond it are burned and thus the blood is restrained; or apply a bandage soaked in strong vinegar or some other binding agent; or place them on medicines whose virtue is to constrict the blood; and strengthen this with a pillow and proper constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	He who administers proper restraint with bandages and compression using cloths or by placing them in positions away from burning causes and similar risks should do so carefully and slowly.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	If one must act and no doctor or medicine is present, then gently press the index finger on the opening of that vein as we have said, and understand the strong constriction inside so that the blood stops flowing from the main part of the wound, and do not move your finger over the artery; and sprinkle cold water over the artery until it becomes congealed and thickened; and then decide whether cauterization or medicine is necessary.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	On incisions and punctures and wind tumors and phlebotomy and wounds and their similarities.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	In the first chapter, we have already discussed all diseases in which cautery with fire is appropriate and burning medicine, as well as the occasions and causes for it, and the instruments necessary for the forms of cauterization; and I have arranged the chapters on the superiority of the head over the body.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	In this procedure in this chapter by that method, so that the patient may be praised for it, at the time concerning what he has asked.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before I begin this, note, son, that in this chapter it is by fear what is in the first chapter about cautery.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And for that which is necessary to be in great caution, because in the operation which is in this chapter many times evacuation of what is harmful to life depends on the aspersio of the vein or incision over the abscess or opening of exit or purging of the plague or extraction of a foreign body or incision of a stone and things similar to these.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And with all of those things accompany fear and trembling, and in the most of their danger death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that upon you does not fall that which is despair, for some times cases depend on your methods of dealing with people and many methods of treating illnesses.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And among them are some who become angry with their illness and are close to death because of the vehemence of what they find in their illness, and due to the length of the illness, and this illness brings fear which signifies death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And among them is the one who gives you all his possessions and says, "I hope for health from you," while their actual illness is deadly.
