The operation there is that the patient places his head in your lap; then open the eyes of that person and collect all that flesh at once appropriately, and with this use forceps or tweezers; then incise the flesh at the beginning until it is completely finished with the scissors, and be careful not to scratch the eye during your operation.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	And your incision should be with the scalpel we have recommended for nail incisions, or with small tweezers with which hair is plucked, depending on the form that will come next according to this chapter.
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	Thus, when your incision is complete and the flesh around it is swollen, now fill the wound with finely crushed salt or sprinkle on red powder similar to corrosive medicines, and apply over it a white cloth to ensure protection from abscesses and cautery.
E si roman alcuna causa de alguardenici e es senhoragat sanc caut, e temes apostema caut, lahoras leyssa le huel e cura aquela apostema am aquo que ceda aquela apostema, e aprop itera sobre aquel am operacio entro que sia sanat, e semblantment fay en la carn ajustada la qual accideys en le huel de aquesta especia.	And if any cause arises to guard against bleeding and the wound is in danger of becoming cauterized, and you fear an abscess from cautery, then leave the wound open and treat that abscess with whatever remedy will cure it, and subsequently proceed with the operation once again as soon as it has healed, and similarly handle the flesh around this type of wound.
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	However, you should be cautious about removing all healing from the wound naturally or accidentally; use tools of iron, and do not place your hand in any of these operations until you see that the member can withstand the operation.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	On the Collection of Pus in the Wound.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	Pus comes from red veins that are swollen over the wound and prohibit its healing, and the wound will become inflamed over a length of days.
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	Therefore, at the beginning, you must consider whether the wound in which pus is present is strong and there is no other illness but pus, then you should collect that pus.
E es que tu comandes al malaute que pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop suspen aquelas venas am un onci o am dos segon la tua prudencia; e sia aquel onci de subtil duplicacio segon aquesta forma:	And it is that you command the patient to place their head in your lap, and then press those veins for one ounce or two seconds according to your discretion; and let that pressing be gentle and gradual as follows:
o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	or press for two ounces gradually in one action according to this method:
E aprop sian colligidas aquelas venas am forses subtils, am subtilitat, e abstergeys le sanc hora aprop hora, entro que vegas aquelas venas esser remaugudas del huel e sian revolgudas.	And bind those veins with fine ligatures, with subtlety, and cleanse the blood hour by hour until you see those veins become empty and be turned back.
E guarda te que tu no ledes le huel am las extremitatz del spatum; e si’ la tua operacio en le miegjorn denant le solelh, e sias mot ferm en la tua operacio que no inscidas sino aquelas venas.	And be careful that you do not lead the blood to the extremities of the body; and if your operation is in the morning before the sun, and be firm in your operation so as not to incise except those veins.
E quan tu auras complitz, lahoras tu distilla en le huel cief vert o rog per que am sa acuitat corrodesca aquo que es remaugut del sabel.	And when you have completed it, then you distill in the blood pure green or red herbs because of their sharpness to dissolve what is hardened in the body.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible colligeys tot en aquela hora, e lahoras tu emplastra tot am aquo que cede la dolor de lu, e leyssa lu per alcus dias entro que sia sedada la dolor de lu e que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	But if this is not possible for you to do at that hour, then apply everything with what alleviates his pain, and leave him for several days until the pain subsides and he is assured of no abscess forming.
E aprop itera sobre lu segon que la mateyssa manieyra entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat upon him according to the same method until he is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de las forfexs:	And this is the form of the forceps:
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	On the reduction of nasal fractures.
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you treat fractures with cauterization or with sharp burning medicine as described and it has not healed, then do not let it remain unattended but cut into the abscess after its maturity, and remove all the humidity that is within it and the pus until the bone is exposed.
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	And when the bone is exposed and you see corruption or blackness in it, then you should treat it with an instrument of which this is the form:
E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent).	He is called the rough head, and it is made of horn, and its head is round just like this one which is made with points by puncturing with a lime or al-iskhafat with subtle punctures (as in the following form).
E pausa aquel sobre le loc corrumput del os, e aprop revolveys aquel entre les tieus ditz, e prem la tua ma petit a petit entro que sapias que aquela corropcio es rasa.	Place it on the corrupted part of the bone, and then rotate it among the said tissues, and press your hand gently little by little until you know that the corruption is scraped off.
E aquo sia fayt alcunas veguadas, e aprop restaura le loc am causas exsiccativas e stipticas.	And do this several times, and then treat the area with astringent and drying agents.
Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat.	When the area is consolidated and good flesh has grown in it, and the core of the unhealthy tissue has been removed and it remains for forty days without being renewed or forming an abscess, and no accident occurs, then you know that it has healed.
E sino, lahoras no es en lu engen sino reduzir la fissura a la forma del nas, e segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu descuebras de segon os am ferr o am medicina acuta, e cum sira descubert le os, lahoras tu pren tribo segon aquesta forma:	And if not, now it is not about generating anything new but reducing the fracture to the shape of the nose, and according to this method: you expose the bone either with force or with sharp medicine, and when the bone is exposed, then you place three pieces in this form:
Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	Let the extremity of the iron be triangular, and the shaft of the iron be gradually narrowed into the extremity just as you see here.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le os, e sia aquel prop del lacrimal; e alongua la tua ma un pauc del huel, e aprop revol la tua ma am le tribo entro que penetre tot le os, e aquel sente le malaute per asso que atroba vent yssir per so quan te la sua ma.	And then place it on the bone, and let it be near the lacrimal bone; extend your hand a little, and then rotate your hand around the three pieces until it penetrates all of the bone, and you will feel the pain because you will notice air escaping when you press it.
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	Now treat the area with astringent and drying medicines as you have been instructed.
Donc cum nays la carn e·l loc es endurazit, lahoras la materia la qual effundia a las partidas deforo retorna al nas, donc aquo es pus leugier sobre le malaute.	Therefore, when the flesh and the place become hardened, at that moment the matter which was discharged to the surroundings returns to the nose, thus it is easier on the patient.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	On the reduction of the prominence of the eye.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the eye protrudes entirely and no harm or diminution occurs to the vision, then it is appropriate to treat the patient, and subsequently follow them; then apply windy plasters to the head without incision and let it drain well through suction; and afterward, apply a liniment on the eye made of aloes, rose petals, myrtle berries, and sarcocolla; then strengthen the plaster over the eye using powdered substances.
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the method for making the powders is to take linen cloths made of the said substances, and each cloth should be folded into four parts; then make the powder from these materials.
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	And then apply those one over the other according to the amount the eye requires.
E aprop strenh sobre aquels am drap dur am fort strictura; e itera las ventosas am succio ses scarificacio; e aprop osta las ventosas e leyssa le huel streyt le dia e la nueyt.	And then apply a hard cloth with tight binding over them; and repeat the plasters and suction without incision; then remove the plasters and let the eye be tightly bandaged day and night.
Mays si entretant le liguament es mollificat, lahoras cove que sia mot streyt.	But if the ligature becomes loose during this time, then it should be made tight again.
E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	And then remove the ligature day and night as we have said.
E si vezes le huel ja esser redusit, bo es, e sino, lahoras itera le emplastre am les polvils e la strictura e las ventosas entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the eye already reduced, that is good, and if not, then repeat the plaster with the powders, binding, and plasters until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	On the incision of the prominence of the uvea.
Quan endeve disrupcio en la tunica uvea, e aprop es eminent e procezeys fora las palpebras ayssi cum un gra de rasim, e es orrazada la forma de home per aquo, e vols aquo inscidir, lahoras la operacio en lu es ayssi cum havem recomtat, que tu entrometas la agula en la razitz de la uvea de la partida dejos en la partida desus, e aprop met la agula autra en la qual sia fil doble de la part del lacrimal, e fay aquela penetrar e leyssa la primieyra agula segon la sua disposicio; e aprop inscideys le loc del fiel doble e leva am aquel la partida de la uvea en le circuit de la agula, e strenh aquela mot.	When you discover disruption in the uvea, and it is prominent and protrudes beyond the eyelids like a grain of barley, and its shape resembles that of a person as described. If you wish to incise this, then during the operation proceed as we have recounted: insert the needle at the edge of the uvea from below upwards, and subsequently place another needle where the double thread is, near the lacrimal area; allow one needle to penetrate while keeping the first needle in its position. Then, incise the location of the double thread and lift that part of the uvea along the course of the needle, and strengthen this motion.
E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	Then withdraw the needle and apply it to the prepared lamb’s fleece soaked in egg white, and allow it to remain there until the thread is with the uvea.
E aprop cura le huel am aquo que conforte aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	Then treat the wound with what comforts it until the injury is healed.
E alcunas veguadas aduna de tota partida am cercle de drap entro le huel ajuste eminencia gran, e aprop sia perforat am le spatum subtil que vengua al preon del huel, e corra la humiditat albuginea, e descen le huel e intra tantost.	And sometimes it is advisable to gather from all sides with a circular piece of cloth around the wound for a large prominence, and then pierce it with a fine probe that reaches the base of the wound, allowing the albuminous moisture to flow out, and the wound will soon descend.
E aprop strenh entro que sia sanat.	Then strengthen it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De curacio de alconati.	On the treatment of contusions.
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This illness, called alconati, is not actually water descending on the wound but rather a condition that affects the wound in a manner similar to it.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	Here is the translation:
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not go down below, know that it is water.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	But if the drainage to the sinus with water as we have said does not happen, now make the patient sit and take a thin spatula and apply it over the pannicular area, close to the junction of the conjunctiva and corneal tunic at the limbus, so that the pus is discharged.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	Once it is discharged, now you should apply hot water in which honey has been mixed or water in which fenugreek and honey have already been boiled.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	On the treatment of water descending from the eye.
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already mentioned the types of water in the division and which are suitable for piercing, as explained earlier, now do so according to the patient's condition.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Now you should make the patient sit between your hands on a chair and pull the affected eye with gentle force.
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre.	And then place your left hand near the eyelid of the affected eye if the water is in the left eye; or use your right hand if it is the right eye.
E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	And then with your right hand take an almond if the eye is left; or with your left hand if the eye is right.
E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	And then place the tip of the almond near the limbus along the thickness of the white of the eye from the side of the smallest tear duct, and then press the almond gently while moving your hand around it.
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	And so proceed to the white of the eye, and feel that the almond is already reached because it is round.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	And measure the path from the almond to the pupil, which is the space between the pupil and the end of the darkness, which is the rim of the eye; for you will see that through the pupil with the clarity of the corneal tissue.
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	And so place the almond in the location where the fluid is, and then pull it down into another area nearby, and if the fluid descends immediately, you will see the defect on which his vision depends immediately, and the almond in its eye.
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	And then rest for a moment; if the fluid has descended, now you should pull that other area before the almond is displaced.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And when it has settled and does not descend, now you extract the almond with ease, and turn your hand little by little, and then dissolve a small amount of clear salt from a gem in the fluid and wash the eye thoroughly with it; and then place over the eye a piece of cloth or stopper or wool infused in rose oil and egg white.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But we and those of our time place over it a dressing soaked in egg white.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the almond does not obey and enter the instrument of the eye due to its hardness—since there are some people whose eye is hard—you should then take the spatula, which is called an alberid, which has this form:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And so pierce with that the conjunction, and do not stop your hand in the track, until you make a way for the almond to move.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And here he enters the almond as we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And you should prepare the patient for the operation by having them sleep on their back in a dark room, and prevent any movements.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And pause in the nature of the water so that its nature becomes smooth, and do not move their head to the right or left at all.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And let the bandaging be according to its condition on the third day.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And then untie it in that dark room and show the patient the wound, explain some causes to them, and then rebandage it on day seven.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And do not do this during the hour of healing or soon after the infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	Handle this so that the water can flow freely and quickly due to great and strong attention.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if an abscess occurs, then you should untie the bandage before the seventh day and treat it with water to help the abscess drain.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Now you should cover the wound and pause on its surface for several days through which the healing occurs, keeping it in a dark room.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	And then gradually move them from that room and converse with them about their condition.
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And know that in alchemy, the disciple is not exempt from observation several times, and now you should be confident about the operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And I have come to us from some of those among whom it is customary, and some said that they make fire in the Airac [orifice] when it has been perforated through which water flows.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	But for my part I have not seen anyone in our land who has done this, nor have I read about it in any of the books of the ancients; and it is possible that this is something new.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	And these are the forms of the species of orifices so that those who are unaware of them may understand them:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	And they are made of iron or proper steel, and their extremities are crafted with this subtlety in a triangular shape, the sharp end exactly as it is formed.
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter XXIV.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	On the treatment of flesh wounds on the nose.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When on the nose there arise various flesh growths that are attached, among which there is one cause that resembles a spider web of heavy threads, or a water polyp; and this illness is called polypus because it resembles such a water creature.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And from it is cancerous flesh, ulcerated, of dark color; and there is also flesh that resembles a lion's but not of a dark color.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore, for the one who has these flesh growths that are not fraudulent or cancerous, it is advisable to make the patient sit between your hands and place it in the sun, and starve the nostrils of them, and apply poultices occasionally to those flesh growths.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then extract that from the inner parts, and then carefully cut away what you have identified of those parts with a sharp, subtle spatula until you know that all the flesh has been removed; if it remains for any reason by which excision is possible, at that time remove it with one of the fine instruments with ease so that nothing remains.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	If the master decides to treat an abscess or ulcer with cautery, then pause at that which is necessary; or if it is one of malignant ulcers, then cut and cauterize that part where the blood vessels have been divided and all cavities are drained.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And if it is necessary to incise near the nose at a place where there is blood or pus.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	If the nose is swollen and the process of moisture extends into the palate, then you will know that it has healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	If the moisture does not penetrate as needed, then you will know that deep within there is flesh that has remained on the surplus bones of the nose to which incision has not reached.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore, it is necessary to insert some thick substance into the place where there is swelling, and use small pieces of cloth, placing an amount equal to the width of a finger or less between each piece, and create openings so that one end of the substance can be placed in the nose either with a probe or for another reason that is possible.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And after this has been done, draw the smell into the passages of the nose so that it settles on his sense of smell, for well-trained people perform this action as children do in schools, and it is an easy cause for those who want to do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then place the two ends of the substance, one end extending outside the nose and the other remaining inside the nose, and subsequently apply a piece of flesh over the cloth that covers the substance, and do this until you know that the flesh is covering the cloths around the substance.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	From the root extract the essence, and place in the nose near the extraction of blood a tube, and do this for three days or more until it consumes all that is around the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And at the end of the treatment, place in the nose a lead tube for several days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you prefer a drying treatment, use that one.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument for making enemas, with which oils and medicines are distilled into the nose:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And make this of silver or gold, which should resemble a small tube, like a small trumpet, and the opening similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you wish, make a closed tube like a reed, and the tube of the instrument for making enemas should be flat and open; to which attach a handle at the back, with which you can hold it when heating in oil or whatever you want from juices and suctionable causes.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And this enema is precious: the recipe for an enema of castor oil, white myrrh, ginger, saffron pepper, long pepper, spikenard, and a single spice in equal amounts of one ounce each. Mix with juice from wheat and cabbage, and make pills; then dissolve one pill in boiled water, and administer it to the patient lying down through the nose.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	About the veins in the extremities of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Most bruises occur in the extremities of the nose, and they are magnified and treated within a few days until such time as it is seen fit to attend to them.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And for this reason, you should address it at the beginning of its appearance and treat all of it.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	And then focus on the place where you cauterize or use medicinal remedies that burn, which are applied there.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if the treatment is delayed until it has become magnified, then consider whether it is hardened, firm, dark in color, and insensitive. At this point, do not touch it with an iron instrument, as doing so might cause severe damage to the one performing the procedure; for many injuries occur due to such careless handling of the condition.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the abscess is soft to the touch and not dark in color, and it is possible to treat it at any location without fear, then evacuate the pus and incise it without hesitation, and care for the area with remedies that dry and heal until it is fully healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	On sewing the nose and lips and ear when the continuity is disrupted by plague or similar causes.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when a disruption in continuity occurs in one of these cartilages, few people are skilled in such an operation.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when dealing with any cause of this nature, you should consider whether it is a fresh wound or due to blood loss. Then, you should approximate the two edges of the wound with stitches and subsequently care for it until it heals.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of a wound of continuity are already separated and each one is made whole, now you must scrape each part of its apparent edge until it becomes clean.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two lips with sutures and strengthen them, and over them sprinkle powder of dragon’s blood and thrice daily apply a plaster of mastic or some other consolidating plaster. Let that lie for two days or three, and then remove it and change the plaster until the pus has ceased to discharge, and then treat with an ointment until it is healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	The method of the suture is that you add the wound of continuity either with needles as we have recommended for the suture of the abdomen, or you may join the wound of continuity with thread as you see fit.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVII.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	On the extraction of those causes that appear in the two lips in their inner parts.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Often in some men in the inner parts of their lips there appear certain hard abscesses resembling flesh of mice, and some of them are smaller and some larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, you must turn the lips and cut open each of those hardnesses from all sides, and then when you have made an incision, fill the place with finely shredded wool until the blood is constricted, and then wash it with vinegar and treat the area with something astringent until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	On the incision of flesh attached to the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	In many cases there appears on the gum flesh attached to which the ancients gave the name albulus; then you should suspend that part with a sponge or have in your hand a sponge and incise that area down to its base, and allow the pus to run out or the blood.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And then apply to the wound powder that is astringent or excitative.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then incise it again secondarily, and cauterize it, for after the cauterization it will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	On the extraction of teeth with forceps.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When on the surface of the teeth of both jaws and between the gums closely attached there are rough, sharp edges, lumps, and some areas are blackened and appear green or yellow, causing corruption to the gum and making the teeth lumpy.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And therefore you should make the patient sit between your hands and place his head on your knees, and extract the teeth in which such rough edges appear and cause grittiness so that none of them remain, and this will remove the blackness and greenish discoloration and other issues so that they are cleansed.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	If this can be done at the beginning of the extraction, that is good; but if not, then you should repeat the extraction on those teeth another day and on the second and third days until it reaches the final stage as you wish.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth have need of various tools of different forms and shapes according to what is prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And because the razors are of the kind with which the tooth is cut from inside are different from those used to rasp between the teeth according to other forms, and these forms of razors you should prepare as you will see shortly:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	On the extraction of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	When you treat the tooth of its pain with all gentleness and delay in total extraction, for there is no remedy that can replace the root once it is extracted, since it is a substance sublime within which makes excuse for the extraction of it.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But when the necessity forces you to extract that tooth, you must firmly be certain which is the painful tooth, for often the pain deceives and leads one to believe it is in a healthy tooth, and you extract that one, but then the pain does not cease until the diseased and painful tooth is extracted, as we have already seen through the operations of surgeons.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, you must be certain which is the painful tooth. Once you know well, then it is necessary that you scarify around the tooth with spatula in which there is some virtue until it dissolves the tooth from the gum entirely, and then take it out using your fingers or with fine forceps little by little until it comes out.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then hold firmly with strong fingers for good traction or firm grasp, and place the head of the patient between your hands so that he is well held without discomfort, and then extract the tooth straight in such a way that you do not break it, nor cause greater pain to the patient.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And so if it is not dislodged, then take one of those instruments and place it there from all sides with ease and exert effort to remove it just as it was done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is loose or corroded, then you should wrap that part in cloth and secure it with a thin thread so that it does not break during your compression on that side holding it.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And you should act carefully during the incision around all parts of the gum and guard with your strength that you do not break or damage it, and return to the problem for the sake of improving it so that it is better than the initial pain.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And be careful not to do what some ignorant barbers do in their hasty and daring attempts at extraction without administering what we have recommended; for many times this leads to serious conditions in patients, which are much harder to treat, and the roots of them become completely or partially destroyed, or you may extract it along with some bones of the mandible as many times has been testified.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And after the extraction of it, the mouth should be washed with cold water or warm salt water.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if there is bleeding due to this, as it often happens, then take some quantity of sugar and sprinkle it over the wound, and if that does not suffice, cauterize it.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The shape of the forceps and subtle holders with which the tooth is grasped at the beginning should be long in length, short in handle, and thick, so that they do not bend when you need to operate with them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	Let them be such as you use for rough handling when straining them, that they may not be folded, but let their extremities be short.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	Let them be made of Indian iron, tapering towards the ends, and at the ends let there be teeth which enter into each other and strain by strong compression, and sometimes the ends of these should have the shape of a bird’s beak called ciconia, that is, a heron, and they should be very strong for constriction.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXXI.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the extraction of teeth and the removal of bones from broken jaws.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you must perform the extraction of a tooth that is broken for some reason, it is necessary to wait and place something over the affected area for one or two days until the site becomes softened; then use tools with ends shaped like those of a bird’s beak called ciconia or heron, which resemble the forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The ends of these should be made like the teeth of a file or rasp.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if it does not obey when you try with these forceps or pincers, then you must probe around the root and remove all the flesh, and insert an instrument called atali, which is a small lever whose shape is as follows:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And let it have a short thick end, and do not insert it too far so that it does not break.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Then if the root is exposed by this method, it is good; and if not, assist with these other instruments of which the forms are as follows: the form of the first instrument is a triangular end in which there is some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The form of the second instrument is that it be triangular and have a very fine tip.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And here is how to use this instrument, which has two edges, whose form is as follows:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and with other instruments which I will describe for scraping teeth; because this tool is made specifically for that purpose, and this is its form:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	of the twisted or bent triangular end, which should have some thickness, and it should not be hidden such that it cannot be grasped.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And another skill is to know the instruments for working on teeth, which are similar to other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the skilled and subtle artisan finds for himself according to what he understands from the operation and various diseases; for there are diseases about which the ancients did not say or leave a proper instrument, due to the forms of different kinds.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the bone of the jaw or other bones in the mouth is grasped, or if you need to extract them, then place a proper cure upon it with what is suitable for the instruments and forceps which we have mentioned for the extraction of tooth roots, and assist with the procedure whose form is as follows:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And it should have some thickness gradually increasing, and it should be tightly held in the mouth so that it does not escape or flee until all the bone is extracted; afterwards, restore the place with suitable medicines.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a small decay in the bone, then remove that which is decayed and its blackness, and treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter XXXII.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	On the treatment of prominent teeth over other teeth.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When the prominent teeth do not follow their natural course and especially when they affect women, and particularly those who are venerable; therefore, you should consider: if a tooth is too close to another tooth and it is impossible to file or apply any substance to it, then you must extract it. But if it is not attached to another tooth, at that time you incise it with this instrument whose shape resembles a pig's tusk, and it is made of Indian iron with an extremely sharp point.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And ensure your incision is such that when you incise it, over the course of several days due to the hardness of the tooth, it does not become connected to other teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is a prominent tooth suitable for filing, then file it with an Indian iron file, which has this shape:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And let it be entirely made of Indian iron and grind it appropriately; it should have small pointed teeth like the file on which needles are made. With this, file the tooth little by little over several days with ease, so that it does not become connected to another tooth and cause harm.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And at the end, smooth it with a linen cloth, and polish it with razors.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if it is a tooth where part of it is broken and you touch the tongue, then you should file down the inside so that the roughness of that fragment is smoothed out and evened, and fill it in so that the tongue does not injure itself nor does speech become impaired.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	On the restoration of defective teeth with gold or silver filling.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When it happens that the front teeth are damaged by impact or displacement due to an accident or fall, and the patient cannot bite properly as a result, and you have treated them with astringent medicines but your treatment has not been effective, then in order to prevent further damage, you should restore those strong teeth with gold and not silver, because silver can tarnish over time, whereas gold never changes.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the filling should be in such subtlety and thickness according to the quantity that can fit between the teeth; the method of the restoration is that you take the filling and place twice its amount between two healthy teeth, and then build up with twists of the filling material between one or more defective teeth until it reaches the adjacent healthy tooth.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then continue the restoration back to the part where you started, and ensure your work is done with ease and skill so that it is not defective.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And when you place the filling, ensure that your handling of the gold or silver does not damage the roots of the teeth.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And then trim the excess filling material with forceps or scissors, and shape it carefully in each place. Convert and conceal these parts between the healthy tooth and the defective one so that they do not injure the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then file that area as smoothly as a Roman coin.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loose or broken, repair that or those parts with additional filling material in such a way at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the alignment of two healthy teeth and of two crooked teeth, as you will see these diagrams:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when it happens that I return one tooth or two near the placement of each in their places, and they grow back as we have recounted, and they become straight.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And only a good artisan and wise person can do this.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes a substitute is made from some cause of the bones of a cow, and it is shaped like a tooth, and it is placed in the location where the tooth is missing, and it is fixed as we have said, and remains and serves for that long.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter XXXIV.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	On the incision of the bandage which is applied to the tongue and prevents speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament which is below the tongue sometimes is natural and one is born with it, or it is accidental and occurs due to an injury that has already healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation is to open the mouth of the patient, his head being in this position; and raise his tongue, and then cut that ligament along its length as far as it separates the tongue from its base.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or knot in that area, and this is due to the healing of an injury, then you should cut through it along its length until you have severed the ligament and dissolved the knot.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful not to make a cut in the surface of the skin so that you do not sever the arteries and cause a flow of blood.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	After washing the residue of the incision with water or vinegar or water and a cloth, place linen below the tongue; this is done so that the bad odor from under the tongue does not spread elsewhere.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	If bleeding occurs, place over the area vitriol powder; but if the blood flows, then cauterize the spot with a hot iron, which is suitable for this purpose.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with other remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	On the extraction of a sublingual cyst.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes, below the tongue, there appears a swelling resembling a small abscess that prevents the tongue from performing its normal function; and it often enlarges to the point of filling the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	The procedure is to open the mouth wide in front of a light source and examine the swelling.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it as dark or black in color and hard, to which the swelling does not respond to touch, then do not attempt to treat it forcefully.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is inclined to a whitish color and appears moist, then you should proceed with the operation, cut it with a fine scalpel, and cut it completely; and if blood flows during your procedure, then place over it powdered zinc sulfate, which helps to stop the bleeding.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then return to your work once you have completed the procedure, washing it with vinegar and salt; and treat it with other remedies as needed until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter xxxvi.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	On the extraction of an abscess from both ears and of that which is near the cheekbone and of other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When I find in the cheekbone a collection of glands that are somewhat assembled and appear outside, which are called the ears, if you treat them as we have said in the division and they do not heal, then consider whether the abscess is hard, dark in color, and with little sensation; at this point, do not touch it with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is red in color and the root is thick, then do not touch it with iron because of the flow of blood; instead, let it remain inside until it is ripe, and then either you will extract it or it will rupture on its own.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is white in color, soft, and the root is subtle, then that one should be incised.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation on it is that you consider, before your operation, whether the abscess has already begun to heal after being treated with rest or if it has diminished in any way; then make the patient sit facing the sun, and place his head to the side, and examine the mouth of the abscess, and the assistant takes between their fingers from below an instrument made of noble material, which has the following form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or iron, and should be as thin as a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	When you press with that instrument and the abscess is shown to you, place your finger carefully over it, then take some material and insert it into the opening, and pull it apart as much as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Other than that, if you wish to cut any cause of the tunics, and appropriately incise with the instrument which has this form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and it is similar to forceps, but the extremities of this one are curved, so that the opening of each of these is in line with the other, sharp, which is made of iron inside.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not at hand, then incise with a scalpel which has this form: It is sharp on one side, not sharp on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And after you have made one incision, make the other according to this method of cutting, and then the wound should be cleansed with water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is bleeding, cleanse it with water from the decoction of lemon peel or mint leaves and similar substances that are astringent until the flow of blood is stopped, and then proceed to treat it until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes these appear in the groin or as abscesses near those two ears, and incise them according to what I have said about the incision of two cuts similarly.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I once treated a woman with an abscess that had appeared in her groin, which was dark in color and painful to the touch, causing it to close up the area of the groin, and she breathed through a narrow passage. She had been prohibited from eating or drinking water, and she would have been near death if I had not intervened within one day or two.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had become so inflamed that it had formed two channels through which it discharged through two openings.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Then I cut it surgically and placed it in one of their vessels, and pulled that out, and from there the larger portion was removed, and then I incised that where I understood the other part to be joined, and then I closed its mouth, and compressed its tongue, and then I placed the vessel in that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I removed a large part of it, and only a little blood flowed from it.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Then the woman was completely cured, and she began to drink water immediately, and soon after she ate food. Therefore, I did not cease to incise that abscess many times over a long period, and another abscess succeeded in its place, which I incised as it became prolonged.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Then I applied something and cauterized the wound of it, then suddenly due to addiction; and after that I wandered around and did not know what God had done for me at that time.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter XXXVII.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On the incision of the breast when it is abscessed.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When one observes catarr in the breast, and it is abscessed and long, it is then called perpendicular; and if it is thick and round in the lower part, it is then called a bubba.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is cured as we have described in the division, and your treatment does not conflict with that cure, and also sometimes there are abscesses that remain stubborn and subtle, then you should incise those that are aggregated and round. And if it extends to a certain length and is bloody, of dark or black color, and is not at the center, then you should attempt its incision because there is fear of malady in that case.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see that according to the method which I have said about its whiteness and length, that you make the patient sit and press the tongue with an instrument of which shows its form and immediately place the incision in the new area, and pull it down and incise it with one of two instruments which are mentioned in the incision of two membranes.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And you must not incise it except as much as is naturally appropriate without addition, for if you incise too much, you will impair their speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And immediately after the incision, use what we have recommended for the incision of two membranes, and care for it until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is frightened by the incision, you should use something to cauterize it without causing fear, and the method of cauterization involves only sharp water. Place the head of the patient in your lap, then immediately press the tongue with the instrument which we have described, and subsequently take the water which we mentioned in the chapter on cauterization, and apply it there as a living cautery, and place it neither thick nor thin, and fill the concavity of the instrument whose shape this is:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the extremity of the cautery on which the medicine is placed be like the concavity of a spoon, and place the instrument with the medicine over the ulcer, and the patient should lie on their side so that saliva or mucus from the mouth does not fall on it due to the intrinsic medicine, so that none of this falls onto it and causes harm.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then take the instrument with the medicine and apply it to the uvula for about a quarter of an hour until you see it become blackened and numbed due to the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you want, take a piece of cotton and wrap it around the end of the reed, and dip the cotton in the medicine, and insert the reed with the cotton into a tube so that the cotton adheres to that tube, and do this as many times as necessary until you achieve what you want from cauterizing the grape, and then leave it there until it dries and falls off after three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you need to repeat the medicine, do so, and then after cauterizing, clean around the grape with cotton soaked in a bordering solution, and modify what is around it with that which is from the medicine, and wash it with water and soap, and treat it externally with an embrocation, and cure it internally according to the remedies until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this particular method of treatment is safer than incision and longer lasting in terms of avoiding fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	In some cases, the small grape is cured with something that cauterizes and incises more gently. It is treated by subfumigation in this manner: take wax, hyssop, thyme, rue, Arabian scammony, chamomile, and similar herbs; mix all of these or some of them in a vessel, and soak them in sour wine, then boil it. The mixture should be heated moderately, and at the bottom of the vessel place a tray, on top of which rests an instrument made of wire in this manner; it can be made of silver or wire.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And place the end in the mouth of the vessel so that the vapor reaches the uvula through the tube, until the uvula is sufficiently treated.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	Then proceed with those incisions into where it is dry, and be careful not to perform this treatment at the beginning of the onset of abscesses, for it would be too early for the abscess, and it is not appropriate for you to do that, but rather you should wait for the formation and maturation of the abscess.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	If this instrument is not present at your disposal, now take a reed and attach to it a piece of horn at one end, so that the mouth of the wound is covered, for the piece of horn prevents the flame from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of thorns and of what adheres to the gums and of other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Incisions are made in what adheres to the gum or a fish bone or any other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then you should extract what is apparent from that, which catches your eye, and after pressing the tongue with an instrument in front of light, so that it becomes clear to you what is in the gum.
