And when someone wants to be bloodletted in any way, it is necessary that they cleanse their bowels before bloodletting with a laxative, if there is retained feces in them, so that the veins do not attract superfluous fluids during the bloodletting of the cleansed bowels, and so that they do not affect the main limbs.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	Let not venesection be performed on patients suffering from sea sickness or drunkenness, nor during the onset of illness or drunkenness when their blood is disturbed, nor in cases of dropsy. Moreover, avoid it if there is fear of colic, vomiting, or abdominal issues, and also if there has been excessive coition, labor, exercise after meals or prolonged wakefulness, or any cause that dissolves strength, whether physical or animal.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And also consider the subtlety of the vapors before determining if the blood is thick, in foods and drinks, and in medicines if that is possible to do.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And also bathe if no cause prohibits it, or exercise in some way to make the blood finer.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And avoid venesection at the height of the day, which is around the third hour, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And ensure that the patient avoids all harmful animal incidents on that day, such as distress, anger, fear, and all physical exertions, such as excessive work, unnecessary labor, sexual activity, and similar activities.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And at the time of seating, have present the causes for which men usually use aromatics and odors, as well as balms and similar substances according to quantity and possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And the one performing venesection should stand on higher ground than the patient who needs to be bled.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And then extend his arm, and clean it with his own hand the veins two or three times; and then wrap the limb with a strap and wind it around twice.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And let the ligature be timely placed, for if the ligature is not equal or if it is excessive, then prohibit the flow of blood; or if it is too slack, then prohibit the coagulation of the blood similarly.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And regarding the ligature, it should be such that he who is to have phlebotomy should rub his arms thoroughly beforehand until the veins are swollen and become apparent.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And regarding the phlebotomist, he anoints his phlebotomy instrument with a little old oil properly. And then places his finger of the left hand on that vein where he wishes to perform the phlebotomy so that the vein slightly recedes and the percussion is set since of the veins it is one which flees as if a cord were fleeing from the phlebotomy, and these are full of air, and when he places the phlebotomy instrument on those, they contract around it, and the phlebotomist understands; and the phlebotomy instrument does not open the vein, and if it opens it, that one is narrow.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And thus, for this reason, it is necessary that the phlebotomist be cautious and diligent in all these matters.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And then place the phlebotomy instrument, but if the vein is open in one spot, that is good; and if not, repeat this at another spot nearby, or above it if there is inflammation, if the area is not abscessed.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the area is abscessed, or the patient becomes weak, then you leave it for a day or two, and do not tighten the bandage, for it will quickly draw out the abscess, nor should the patient enter a bath.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	About the vein-cutting let it be said if you love it.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the aperture is small and lets blood finely, and you fear that it will not yield the quantity of blood that you wish, then repeat the venesection in that spot according to straightness and adjust the aperture a bit, and do this with haste before the place becomes abscessed, for the place becomes abscessed in most men after little aperture.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if you see that it is already abscessed, then do not repeat it there, for it will serve you no purpose; and apply some part of the poultice of oil, for it disperses the blood.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And in this case, olive oil is better than other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And similarly, apply a poultice of olive oil to every venesection where you cut the veins beyond the prohibition of blood flow, and do this with turpentine al-fadhak and sage when applied over the spot, for the blood is refined and becomes thin when it is thick.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if a large abscess is generated in the place of the venesection, which happens sometimes, especially to those who have not been bled before except that time, or where there was little aperture of the vein, and then you should incise it, and apply over the spot a sponge infused in water and salt, slightly heated, and press that for one hour, for it dissolves.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And it is necessary to do this near the discharge of blood from that vein or from another vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if a black or greenish discoloration remains in the spot for several days, do not worry about it; and if you wish, apply some preparation of aloes and myrrh dissolved, or some preparation of mint juice or plaster or something similar.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And from swellings there arise abscesses and elevations which require phlebotomy at the base.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And therefore place your hand on that area, and if you find it soft, apply pressure to that spot; then that elevation is evil and bad. And be careful not to place anything there for any of the reasons mentioned, as blood will flow strongly from an artery.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And apply a plaster with styptic properties to that area so the spot becomes hardened, and treat it with other remedies until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And it is necessary to extract blood from everyone in proportion to the quantity of their strength and according to the color appearing on top of the blood.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	For if the blood is black, then let it flow until it becomes red; and similarly, if you see it thick, let it flow until it becomes thin; and likewise, if it is acute, until its sharpness is abated.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat. E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best method to use in venous phlebotomy is the cross-section cut, not puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	And this method of phlebotomy is safe from blood flow and nerve injury, and it is more effective and safer than phlebotomy based on latitude and longitude.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre. And if fainting occurs during phlebotomy and is caused by the loss of sweet blood, then give them to drink watered sweet syrup and a subtle fragrant syrup; and use aromatics with sugar, and let them hold their nose with it.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other causes that we have mentioned in the division in the chapter on fainting due to evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And for those who wish to prevent their arm from swelling and to dissolve their blood a second time, it is suitable for them that the phlebotomy is for gentle evacuation, and its effect is to evacuate the blood little by little, as is according to the quantity of strength over continuous days.

Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	Place that body in which the blood has become heated and excited and causes fever in such a way that the blood is let from it in one vein, and there should be a large quantity removed until fainting occurs, so that you maintain all the conditions of phlebotomy; and place your hand on the pulse of the side from which the blood is being let, so that death does not occur instead of fainting, for this often happens when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal. E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas. E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient immerses their hand in cold water until it turns red and the vein appears clearly.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	Here is the translation:
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And let the incision be wide and let your phlebotomy on it, which you perform over the joint of the hand, be small.

Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you are in the days of summer, now you are exempt from the immersion of the hand in hot water, and similarly the flow of blood is paused in hot water during winter.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is safer than that of all other veins, because there are no pulsating veins or nerves there.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the right hand's vein is beneficial for diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of this phlebotomy is that you bind the hand with a ligature or with your hand, after placing it in hot water, until the vein is swollen and clearly visible to the observer; then make the incision transversely across it; and if you do not perform this correctly, none of this will be known.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And be careful not to leave your hand exposed after the phlebotomy, because there are nerves among the aforementioned areas stripped of flesh.

Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	Here is the translation:
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And so it seems in the phlebotomy of the artery as you have done in the other.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the benefit of the vena cephalica in phlebotomy is for diseases that are below the waist, such as diseases of the legs, and retention of menstruation, and for diseases of the joints and ulcers of old wounds, and similar ailments.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the procedure for phlebotomy of the artery is that the patient immerses his foot in hot water and then rubs it until the veins become visible; and he places a cord around the joint of the foot; and the location of the vein is on the front part of the foot, and from there it branches out over the surface of the foot in several places.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And therefore, phlebotomize the largest branch below the joint in front of the ankle, for it is better and more effective.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you perform phlebotomy on the surface of the foot, then be careful of the nerves that are below it on the surface of the foot, and stop your phlebotomy when you reach a point where you would otherwise cut across.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And so the phlebotomy is complete.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the release of blood is prohibited; then immerse the foot in hot water again and allow the blood to flow naturally until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist makes a mistake on the first attempt, then repeat the phlebotomy slightly above it, for that location is effective; and do not fear making a small error, but be careful of the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And in the same way I apply the scalpel to the other part equally.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, you should locate it as we have said, below the heel behind the cavity of the sole.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the procedure for phlebotomy on him is behind the hip when it is for therapeutic bleeding.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of the phlebotomy on him is that the patient should enter a bath, and quickly and tightly wrap his leg from the waist to below the heel with four fingers in a thin strip of cloth, so that it does not appear otherwise.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And when it appears, now you should perform phlebotomy on that spot according to each angle that is possible for you and according to the transverse position; or incise that area by incision or cut it by section, as the location of it is suitable.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in the words of men somewhat hidden; and if you find that spot, and it does not appear to full sensation, now phlebotomize some branch of it, which appears between the thumb and the ring finger on the back of the hand.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And be careful of the nerves, and let the blood flow in the quantity that you wish.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then loosen the binding and place a pad over the phlebotomy site, securing it tightly, for healing occurs quickly.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of venesection and of the qualities of using those methods.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Venesections should be done with horns, or ivory, or wood.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	Of bloodletting there are two methods: one involves incision and extraction of blood, and the other is bloodletting without incision.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this bloodletting which is without incision is done in two ways, as it can be with heat or without heat.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And for bloodlettings that are administered with incision and extraction of blood there are fourteen locations on the body, of which one is where phlebotomies are performed in al-nocrati, which is at the very back of the head; another location is just below both sides of the neck; phlebotomies of the chin below the jaw near the mouth; phlebotomies of the two cheekbones; phlebotomies of alohoster, which is above the collarbone; phlebotomies of two armpits; and phlebotomies of two thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And bloodletting that does not extract the blood but rather affects the small veins spread in the flesh, and by this it does not capture the virtue as it would with phlebotomy; nor is it necessary for bloodletting to be done with heat or without heat in any disease caused by repletion, so that the entire body may be evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity prompts bloodletting due to illness or continuously, administer it at any time at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, in the middle of the month, and at whatever times may be appropriate.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The reason for this is that there are people in whom blood is multiplied internally to the point where they need extraction through bloodletting; and in such individuals, you find heaviness and heat in their head. In others, you notice repletion and hardness in their face and head, as well as neck. Some show premature aging on their face and forehead, with darkness and dullness in their eyes. Others have the location of their bloodletting visibly affected. There are those whose pulse is multiplied. And there are some who taste blood in their mouth or whose tongue is coated with a substance that causes them to spit blood. Additionally, there are those whose sleep is excessive, and others who see blood during sleep along with pains and other similar symptoms.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	Therefore, when you encounter any such case among those mentioned, and especially if it is in the third or middle of the month, I command that ventilation be made after two or three hours have passed since midday.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of ventilation from the neck is that when it relieves gravity in the head and what has settled in the temples; but it should be done in such a way that it also aids in the evacuation of the entire body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this ventilation is at the site of the phlebotomy of the cephalic region.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not advisable to use it on one who has a complete fever, or in one who has a cold, for it can cause great harm to them.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And because of this, it should not be used on the elderly, and those whose heads are often diseased.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But for one who is continuously lying on it, forgetfulness may occur; and because of this, you should command the person performing the ventilation to pause their work briefly by lifting the cup away from the area to prevent the generation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But ventilation of the forehead is at the site of phlebotomy of the dark vein and the basilic vein: and because of this, it relieves asthma, constriction of the chest, splitting of the sternum, coughing, and congestion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is necessary to apply the forehead cupping lightly, for if it is left too long, it can cause weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And the ventilation of the temples relieves pain in the head, ophthalmia, headache, nasal congestion, and pain in the roots of the teeth; and it is at the site of phlebotomy of the basilic vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And you should order the barber-surgeon not to press too hard with his hand during incision so as not to cut an artery and cause a flow of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And in suction, place the chin to confer with the palate in the mouth, and for the corruption of the gums, and for the appearance of the diseases that are in the mouth, and stand as a substitute for phlebotomy between the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But the suction that is performed on the two spatulas corresponds to capitation, which is made by an accumulation of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the suction of both parts inside the fingers corresponds to the puncture of three veins, namely the basilica, fusca, and cephalic, because it attracts blood from all those larger veins that are in the flesh, and these smaller veins from other thicker veins until the attraction reaches the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And order the barber-surgeon not to proceed too much in incision, for the area is bare of flesh, and leave it lest you injure nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a suction that is performed on the thighs and corresponds to hemorrhoids of the anus and to ulcers that are nearby.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And you should order the barber-surgeon to use a large suction cup, and let it be made of horn, for the area requires strong drying; and apply strong suctions followed by subtle ones and let it be incised during incision.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But small suction cups should be used with meticulous care, for they draw blood from the entire body, and correspond to chronic pains in the loins and lower back, and of the bladder; and they provoke menstruation, and correspond to bothor (boil) and ademil (pustule); and stand as a substitute for phlebotomy of two saphena veins, alahorcoben, and two cavilhas.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, these weaken the whole body and cause syncope in some men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And of the windy ones, apply the dressing to the wound from the side opposite the windy ones of two sides.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the dressings is that you place the dressing at the beginning dry and then change it according to the season, and do not prolong the position of the dressings, but place them lightly, and remove them cautiously, so that the humors come to the site appropriately.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not stop repeating this and continue until you see the area turn red and swell, and the rigor of the blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	Now you should incise and change the dressing little by little, and then consider the disposition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For the man who has tender flesh with few pores should be incised once and not more, so that the area does not become ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And instruct the dresser to enlarge the incision slightly and proceed with the dressing with ease and promptness.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thick, then it is necessary to incise twice, because on the first incision the way for the subtlety of the blood and its moisture is opened.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But on the second incision, it is for the thorough extraction of the thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very impure, then a third incision should be made so that it achieves the desired result.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	In conclusion, when we want to extract the blood little by little or a small amount, a scarification is sufficient for us.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract more blood, we perform two scarifications; and if we know that the blood is thick, then it is necessary to scarify with a deeper incision.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term "scarification" refers to the depth of the incision being only superficial.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the skin of the person to be scarified is thick, hard, dark, and has small pores, it is necessary to anoint the areas for cupping with soothing, penetrating, and resolving oils; in summer, such as aloes oil or violet oil, or oil of daisies, or chickweed oil; and in winter, narcissus oil, lily oil, camomile oil, or similar.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the excess is thick and congealed, then the oil should be henna oil, or balsam oil, or aloes oil, or anise oil, or similar.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the cupping vessel has wide pores and is applied to soft flesh, then it should be prohibited from oil, and before the application of cupping, the areas where the cups will be placed should be washed with rose water or cold water mixed with solutrum, or chickweed water, or betony water, or similar.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for the person whose blood has much moisture, wash their cupping areas with vinegar water, or with water of myrtle and sumac, or similar.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for the person whose excesses are thick, wash their cupping areas with old vinegar, or with water of savory, which is marjoram, or decoction of anise, or chamomile, or similar.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	Therefore, ensure that the suction is preserved before bathing; handle it so that it is administered shortly after bathing for one or two hours, and make sure they sleep near the suction.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is needed to be done to regulate the use of suction or bloodletting before suction therapy.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	At the beginning, if the one who is to perform suction or the one who needs phlebotomy is choleric and there is wind in the sharp blood with inflammation, then it is necessary for them to take cooling causes, such as sour grapes, endive with vinegar and lettuce, saffron, julep, and similar things.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And let them pause from their foods such as pork, and meat of beneficial birds, and seasoned foods with acids, and similar things.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for the one whose constitution is weak, let them drink rose syrup, or saffron syrup made from seeds, and sumac, and something fragrant midway between morning and noon; and advise them to use moderation in drinking and eating, and to avoid foods such as pork, fish, poultry, small birds, and dove.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And on the day of suction and phlebotomy, let their drinking be more than their food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And let it be given to them to drink at certain times ambergris alcohol or medicine of musk, such as muscat, or alepheta before suction or phlebotomy or shortly after, so that the principal members are comforted and the blood is refined; and they should not take those heating substances.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	Here are the veins that should be used for venesection: those located in the region of the neck, on the sole and ankle, on the navel, at the joints, and in the hollow of the armpit, because these members cannot endure incisions upon them.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And they are not sought for any other purpose than to attract blood from a member, just as we apply cupping to the breast in cases of excessive bleeding from the nose; and they use it where there is need to dissolve solidified congestion in a member, just as we apply it to the abdomen and navel; for this rarifies the member, heats it up, and alleviates the pain by resolving the congestion.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And cupping should be applied to the nostrils when they are blocked or stuffy, for by the power of attraction it raises the obstructed matter and eliminates the phlegm from its location.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly, it does the same when applied to the chest and sole due to congestion, as it releases what is enclosed there.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these cuppings should be administered only with suction; some are also applied over fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some cuppings should be administered filled with hot water in cases of ailments affecting the sole.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is because the cupping vessel should be full and larger; it can be hot water alone or water in which suitable herbs have been boiled.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of a cupping vessel applied with fire: the diameter of its opening should be two fingers wide, as we have formed it; and the quantity of the interior space should be half a palm; and in its middle, at the place that is in the circuit, it should be half as well, the thickness should be small according to the amount that fits inside a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Make a pad of egg whites or citrus peel, of thick margins, linen, bands and clean so that it does not lead to the limb being placed upon it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And place above it a crossbar of wood or iron, on which is placed a candle for the light.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this suction cup should be larger than the one we have recommended; and the size of it according to the illnesses and the condition of the person using it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the suction cups for children and weakened individuals should be smaller than those for young adults and people with larger frames.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of placing this suction cup over the fire on the limb is that it should extend the skin over the fire properly in front of a small candle made of wax, and place it above the crossbar in the proper location of the suction cup, so that the fire is lit around the lower part to prevent the patient's body from being burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And it should be placed directly on the limb of the patient, and the hand should be on the area we have mentioned, so that when we use the suction cups and do not need to hold the hand while steam is applied over that area, the suction cup will dissolve quickly.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And gently apply heat to the skin according to its manner, and repeat this if you need to use it again.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in the suction cup that is administered for pleurisy, it is filled with water, in which there is no crossbar or area mentioned, and it is not applied except when it is filled with water and placed on the limb.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its form: And the larger this suction cup is, the better, because it can receive a greater quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter xcviij.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Bloodletting should not be administered in movable members but in those members where the application of suction cups is impossible due to their small size, such as the gums and similar areas; or on parts bare of flesh, such as the fingers and nose and similar areas.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those leeches that you have found should be in the waters below, clean and free from corruption.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then they should be left in the water below for a day and night until they are hungry, so that there is no remaining cause in their belly; and then evacuate the body at the beginning of phlebotomy and suction cup application; and then rub the patient's limb until it reddens; and then place them on it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and swollen.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if suction can be applied to the area with a cup, it is better for recovery.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the area with vinegar and then with warm water; and it should be rubbed and squeezed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the blood extends from the site of the leech bites and there is residual blood, then place a piece of cloth on cold water, and apply it until the bleeding stops.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the bleeding increases, then sprinkle powdered vitriol or similar astringent powders on it until the bleeding stops; or apply masticated fava beans to the site, and leave them there until they adhere to the area, at which point the bleeding will be stopped.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	In circumcision, if it is necessary, repeat the application of bloodletting strips, when it is possible to change those.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the bloodletting strips are prohibited from suspension, then at that time it should be washed with fresh blood or leave a needle in the places between which there is blood; and afterwards they should be paused, because those when feeling any blood will quickly heal.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want to stop bleeding, sprinkle a little powdered aloes, or salt, or ash over it, and the bleeding will quickly cease.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the chapter of the third part: on restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is often considered necessary in the art of medicine; it is the restoration of fractures and dislocations of bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, be aware that those who boast about this chapter are foolish doctors and the vulgar, as well as those who for any length of time have not regarded the books of the Ancients or read a single letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason it is done that this method of the scientists in our land is private; and I have not forgotten it for any length of time at all; and I have not applied what follows, but through the length of reading the books of the Ancients and studying to understand them, until I extracted the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then I directed myself to experimentation and study throughout the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that my science contains and on which my experience is based; now I abbreviate it for you and free it from the burden of lengthiness; and abbreviate it to the point of brevity; and demonstrate it at the end of clarification; and form many forms of the instruments used therein, as added by explanation, just as I have done in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	A summary and collection of fractures of the bones, from which a preliminary explanation is necessary before we begin to recall the parts of fractures and their various types.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us proceed with the prologue of this chapter to summarize the discourse; and the chapters that are essential for understanding at the beginning are necessary for the craftsman and to stand on the truth of those things; it is for you and others like you who wish to know or learn this noble art.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And so I say that when it happens to someone to have a fracture, dislocation, torsion, or fall, at that moment it is necessary for you to consider at the beginning whether to perform venesection or to bandage them, or any other immediate treatment, if there are no prohibitive causes, such as weakness of strength, or if it happens to an infant, or an elderly person in decline, or during a time of extreme heat or severe cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And you should be content with food such as fresh herbs and the meat of birds and small animals; we prohibit fatty meats and foods that fill the body excessively, and all food that fills the veins with blood, until you are sure of an abscess being cured, and if you do not fear an effusion of matter into the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And now return the patient to their original regimen that they were accustomed to follow.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And so when the broken bone begins to be restored, it is necessary that the patient be fed with nutritious foods that are moist and heavy, in which there is viscosity, such as food made from boiled wheat with water, rice, peas, beef tripe, eggs, fresh fish, and similar foods, and with this regimen, healing of the fracture occurs more easily and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that the bones in those who are old and in young children, as well as in the elderly, cannot be set or consolidated according to their nature by the drying of the members.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are set and consolidated according to their nature for a long time by the drying of those members, and they remain set and consolidated until the end of their softness, just as the bones of young children do.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature adjusts and applies them over the broken bone from all parts for some cause similar to glue, in which there is a thickness that adheres and strengthens it as they congeal together until the end of its strength and firmness, just as fire at the beginning does not prevent it from performing its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary to avoid giving the patient foods that are heavy and viscous and gross, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	The variety of fractures depends on the variety of the member. 
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fractures are diverse according to the diversity of the members, for the fracture of the bone of the chest is different from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is different from the fracture of the bone of the arm; and similarly all other members are different among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And you will find a description of every type of fracture, expanded in its own separate chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Consider the diversity of fractures within themselves.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the types of bone fractures are diverse within themselves; for there is one type of curved fracture different from those that occur in the stars; and some fractures are made according to the length of the bone: and among the fractures of the shaft and splinters and complete and incomplete, just as it is done when a pen is prepared for writing, there is a fracture due to impact and disruption in the head, and there is a small crack fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And each type has its own proper treatment in the restoration of it, as will be recalled separately in their respective places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Consider the signs of a bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by this a bone fracture is known: its twisting, and the prominence and appearance of it to the touch, and what happens when you press on it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore, when there is no apparent twisting in the location or sound, and when you touch the bone with pressure and the patient does not feel great pain, then there is no fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	However, it is possible that there may be twisting or a small crack. In this case, do not press on it with your hand and compress it entirely; instead, wait and apply the medicines of which mention will be made shortly at the moment when it is appropriate to do so; and it may also be narrow due to subtle constriction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that when the place is arched and not divided into two or another part where it does not suffer from swelling, you should begin from your hour to correct the condition of the affected area where an abscess occurs.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if an abscess occurs there, then leave it for some days until the abscess subsides; and afterwards bandage it according to each method that you can of lightness and of support.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the restoration of it and the alignment of it is easier than with the bone in which swelling has occurred.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And afterwards strengthen it according to what will come to mind regarding it.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the bone is swollen, then it is necessary to extend this broken limb from both parts, whether it is the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the member is small; or with two cords or one cord and your hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And place yourself in such a position that you can put the limb in a bandage according to its natural figure, while the parts of the broken member are extended, then it forces you to return those addictions with support and according to each way that you can in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And be careful according to your strength that no harm comes from your operation either by injury or damage; and strive according to your ability to apply one bone to its companion bone according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it is necessary that at that opportune moment you touch with your hand that which needs attention, and if you see any diverse cause, correct it and bandage it according to the extent of your skill.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And from an incorrect and excessive extension or compression, so do false physicians cause an abscess to occur through their operation, or they cause a contraction in the limb as we have seen this happen due to their improper manipulations.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And in connection with this, properly join and equalize the appropriate operation and restriction of that limb; ensure rest and tranquility. Warn the patient about this and see that they do not harm themselves during their wakeful hours or while sleeping, observe their agitation and movement, and examine all their actions with full attention; and wait until the position of the limb is such that it ensures relief from pain, which happens because when in a certain position, there is pain or injury. Therefore, change to another position where there is no pain; and ensure that this position is straight and equal so that the limb does not become distorted when restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the restriction of the tranquil limb is what I recommend; because you should know that broken limbs vary in their smallness and greatness and in the form of each one.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small, such as the arm and the finger and similar ones, the wrapping should be of soft fine cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But for those that are large, such as the thigh or the chest, it is necessary to wrap them with hard bandages, because these bandages connect and secure the large limb firmly from all sides in an equal restriction, so that no dirt enters.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And when you begin, after the proper equalization of the limb, pause conveniently for that, on the site of the fracture with three or four layers of bandages depending on the limb; and tighten your hand a little with the bandage.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And apply to it the most sovereign poultice for the place of the fracture, and tighten moderately that bandage with which you have bound the place of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then lengthen the bandage around the place of the fracture a little, and loosen the binding gradually, until you take off most of it.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap it around the broken place with a binding, and afterwards apply to it the bindings below the fracture; and let your operation be in the tightening of the binding and in the loosening of that one as we have said about the first binding above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then place between the bandages a piece of soft linen or cloth on which the unevenness of the fracture is padded, if there is any unevenness; and if not, do not place anything there for this reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then place on the other bandage, and afterwards apply plasters properly made soon if there is no inflammation or abscess in the area, and now place on that which cures the abscess and reduces the swelling; and leave this for several days; and then you tighten over it the bandages.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And let the plasters be half a cubit wide in length, and well formed wisely; or let them be made of willow wood; or from strips of palm; and let the width of each plaster be according to this form and this figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, the plaster that is placed over the fracture should be a little thicker and longer than the others, and the length of the plaster according to how it fits the limb in size and smallness; and then tighten over the plasters another bandage as your first binding; and afterwards bind above with wax moderately as we have said about binding, and it is that your binding should be tighter near the fracture, and as much as it is distant from the fracture, the binding should be looser.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And let the threads be medium in thickness and fineness, and let them be soft; and if the threads are thick, as I have seen some foolish people use ropes of twisted hemp for their threads, it is a great mistake, when one considers the equality of tension.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And likewise, very fine threads are not appropriate, for you will not achieve the desired tension with them, and it is necessary that there be not less than one digit between knot and knot.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is injured at the ends of the bones near the sutures in such places, then pause and use threads of lion’s sinew or matted wool until it does not cause harm to him.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture occurs due to a blow, and there is a disruption in the chain, and I recall this particular case in the second chapter.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that not all broken members should be set with splints on the first day; the reason for this is that when the member is large, it should not be placed on splints immediately but after about five or seven days or more, according to your certainty of the occurrence of an abscess.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the method of plasters with which the Ancients restored fractures, dislocations, and twists, which were applied over injuries.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of a plaster for the quick restoration of fractures, suitable for delicate conditions and especially for women and children, as it does not generate heat or irritation: take flour powder, which is the residue from the grinding process that sticks to the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And confine it as it is, but sieve it with white cloth, and pause the compounding of it not thin nor subtle; and then use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method for plasters to restore fractures, dislocations, and twists: recipe of asafetida, of lead danum, of acacia, of inula, and migrauch, which is the rind of wild millet, of each a drachm x; of myrrh and aloes each a drachm v; aloe chil each a drachm xx; all are to be ground and sieved together and mixed with water or with white cloth if the preparation is warm; and then use this plaster, for it is well composed and quickly restores broken bones, and confers health upon men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method for a plaster to treat fractures and twists: recipe of migrauch (rind of wild millet) and met of white lead each a drachm x; of myrrh and aloes each a drachm v; of acacia a drachm vi; of Armenian bole a drachm xx.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All should be triturated in a mortar with a pounding motion, and then sieved, and compounded with water or with white cloth if the mixture is warm, and it should be administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method for a plaster for joints and bones that have come out of their places, and for accidental pain in those areas and for fissures and fractures: take clean wool and immerse it in vinegar and warm oil and apply it to the area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Note that this plaster is not for restoration, but for abscesses and properly expelling pains.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method for a plaster that restores broken bones: take fresh leaves of the fig tree and leaves of wild poppy; crush them together and make a plaster from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of applying a shortened plaster for the restoration of a bone fracture and when you want to resolve the remnant of an abscess: take rhizomes of elder, chamomile flowers, and violets, and flour of spelt, of each one part; mix all finely and cook in wine, if the member is not burned.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is burned, now confect that in cold cilantro water or in water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of a stronger plaster for resolution than this first one, when there occurs a hard abscess during the restoration of the limb: take rhizomes of elder and seeds of linseed, and buckthorn, melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, of each one equal part; all should be finely mixed and cooked in savory water or warm water or in wine, whichever is appropriate according to the quality of the limb and the condition indicated by its appearance.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	However, Hippocrates does not mention in his book that it should be paused on the broken limb during its restoration other than cerot made of wax and oil, and he recommends that it be midway between thickness and fineness.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	However, Galen is seen to have them applied on the broken limb during its restoration and for causes in which there is drying with a little heat as well as substances like myrrh, saffron, and similar to those causes that we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of plaster to relieve injury and pain: take linseed, sesame seeds, human hair cut or bird's feather, elder rhizome, and salt, in equal parts; mix them finely and sieve them and cook them, then make a plaster.
